citeinfo.origin: The Bering Sea Project NSF/NPRB BEST-BSIERP
citeinfo.title: Marine Regions for the Bering Sea Integrated Ecosystem Research Program

descript.abstract: A total of 16 marine regions on the Bering Sea shelf and slope were drawn based on a consensus across researchers of the joint Bering Ecosystem Study - Bering Sea Integrated Research Program. The consensus is based on observed oceanography, bathymetry, benthic fauna, fish, seabird and marine mammal distribution, as well as established survey strata and ecological domains (for the Pribilof Islands). These regions by no means preclude the development of process-specific maps by individual projects, nor do they represent strictly biogeographic domains. Rather they are a negotiated practical spatial division weighted by the spatial aggregation of biological data and/or large scale oceanographic characteristics.
descript.purpose: Facilitate spatial comparisons across projects when aggregating values/averages, data, statistics, etc; Model validation (when using regional averages rather than point data).

spdom.descgeog: Eastern Bering Sea shelf and slope

idinfo.accconst: Contact Point Of Contact for data request form.
idinfo.useconst: User must read and fully comprehend the metadata prior to use. Applications or inferences derived from the data should be carefully considered for accuracy. Acknowledgement of BEST-BSIERP, as the source from which these data were obtained in any publications and publications and / or other representations of these data, is suggested

distinfo.distliab: No warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with the data. The NPRB shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described or contained herein.
